item.title: Jocardo add a quote by Andrew Davidson
item.description: "God cannot be referred to as 'good,' 'better,' or 'best' because He is above all things. If a man says that God is wise, the man is lying because anything that is wise can become wiser. Anything that a man might say about God is incorrect... The best a man can do is to remain silent...The true master knows that if he had a God he could understand, he would never hold Him to be God." -- Andrew Davidson

item.title: Jocardo add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Jocardo add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "So, please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookcase on the wall." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Jocardo add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jocardo add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely." -- Roald Dahl
